description: From Ancient Greek [Term?] epistēmikós, from ἐπιστήμη (epistḗmē, “science, knowledge”).

entries.meaning: Of or relating to knowledge or cognition; cognitive.
examples: Metaphors provide epistemic access to the world via the articulation of new ideas at a stage when literal language cannot cope.

entries.meaning: Of or relating to the metaknowledge and theory of knowledge (epistemology).
examples: Audi considers whether Chisholm might be able to incorporate into his epistemic system an internalist evidential grounding requirement.
